ygData.subject: RE: Speed of a bard
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well this is wrong from first hand experiance. After the first zone crash in the Plane of Fear (full spawn eeek!) we had a guide helping us by ressurecting
ygData.messageBody:
At 08:45 AM 10/13/1999 -0600, you wrote:
>From: "Blair, Keith (Keith Blair)" <kblair@...>
>
>> I wonder if the GM/Guide bards have a percussion
>> instrument that is above, and beyond, the Drum of
>> Selo's March and/or Mistmoore Battledrum. You
>> should have offered to trade :)
>
>From a reliable source.. Guides do not get *any* of their
>class's spells or songs. They also do not get any
>instruments or weapons (other than their staff of guiding)
>to weild. They apparently have a belt of something or
>another that gives them Spirit of Norrath. The guide you
>saw running around wasn't using Selo's or a drum..
>

Well this is wrong from first hand experiance. After the first zone crash
in the Plane of Fear (full spawn eeek!) we had a guide helping us by
ressurecting and recovering our corpses for us. He would summon us to our
corpse in the PoF and then do a ressurection. I thought this was damn odd,
because he was a lvl 50 cleric guide and was using his lvl 49 spell to do
this. And he had to meditate after each time. I have been ressurected
before by our GM and he didnt med or cast, just zapped away. Maybe this was
just a freak occurance, i dont know, but he definately had his spells :)

Gendal Concorden, lvl 50 bard
Enoch Lyciferous, lvl 40 Necromancer
Tunare
